item.title: Pussycat A Go Go Las Vegas: A Wild Ride Through Vintage Strip History
item.description:
The Dawn of a New Vegas Vibe: Pussycat A Go Go

The Las Vegas Strip wasn’t always about high-roller casinos and choreographed fountain shows. In the mid-1960s, it was undergoing a cultural metamorphosis, transitioning from the Rat Packâ€™s sophisticated supper clubs to something raw, energetic, and decidedly more rebellious. Enter Pussycat A Go Go, a club that perfectly embodied this seismic shift. Opened in 1964, this legendary hotspot, now sadly beneath the sprawling Wynn Resort, remains a crucial piece of vintage Las Vegas history.
